Message.Title: Goldman Sachs's Kostin and his team say the index looks fully valued for now
Message.Msg: ........Goldman Sachs : The market reached its year-end target of 1,625 “much faster than we expected,” Chief U.S. Equity Strategist David Kostin said in the “U.S. Weekly Kickstart,” dated Friday. But is the firm nervous? No way. Kostin and his team say the index looks fully valued for now,

Message.Msg: Hey after waiting an eternity for a search to be finish it finally shows me the LEAST relevent messages first from 6 years ago. Are they stupid? how do I change that default to show most recent? SW programmers at IBM must graduate from ...

202.860001 just crossed. That's not a result of apportioning or averaging in a basket trade. That's some clown who thinks he just has to jump the book. The fifth and sixth decimals aren't even supposed to be available to a stock with a price this high.

Message.Title: IBM (Indian Business Model)
Message.Msg: Honest article on Seeking Alpha re IBM . http://seekingalpha.com/article/1430481-ibm-how-much-longer-do-the-good-times-last?source=email_rt_article_readmore

Message.Title: Indian Business Model
Message.Msg: This recent quote from a "former IBM exec who spoke on the condition of anonymity" prompted revisiting the company and again asking some questions about their business model and future prospects: "Realizing this, IBM's become a holding company of sorts, buying assets, integrating them and reselling them as an IBM brand." "IBM does not want to fund its own development because past history shows we're not very good at it." Stock Performance IBM has been a remarkably successful stock in recent years (and is about 12% of the gain propelling the DJIA to record highs since the 2009 low) and Wall Street loves the company as a result. Here are returns over the last five years: IBM data by YCharts Top line growth however looks more like the surf report for a birdbath on a windless day, even as the bottom line is up over 50% in the same period:
